artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Author: Kikuyōtei Rokō; Publisher: Daikokuya Kinnosuke
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 134.1; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 23 no. 26, p. 288.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: ink drawing with red, purple, yellow, green and blue; standing woman with floral decorations and red and white strands of beads in her hair, wearing multicolored draping scarves around her upper body, pointing with her PL hand at two impaled heads on a red, white and yellow staff, and holding a severed head with open mouth in her PL hand; trees behind her
portfolio: From One Hundred Tales from Japan and China (Wakan hyaku monogatari 和漢百物語)
signed: 一魁斎芳年画 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi ga}
title: Keyblock drawing for "Lady Huayang"
